byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran, and Andrew Siddons from Washington.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Iranian officials back away from their willingness to ship atomic fuel outside country, compromising critical element of nuclear agreement only two days before deadline; had tentatively agreed to send large portion of uranium stockpile to Russia, reducing availability for future weapons program; Western officials insist that there are alternatives, but dilemma has been seized upon by critics in United States, Israel and Saudi Arabia.
lead_paragraph: With a negotiating deadline on Tuesday, Iranian officials have backed away from a critical element of a proposed nuclear agreement, saying they are no longer willing to ship their atomic fuel out of the country.

headline.main: Iran Backs Away From Key Detail in Nuclear Deal
headline.print_headline: Iran Backs Away From Key Detail in Nuclear Deal

snippet: With a negotiating deadline on Tuesday, Iranian officials have backed away from a critical element of a proposed nuclear agreement, saying they are no longer willing to ship their atomic fuel out of the country.
